conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and how it will be directed into containers E, F, or G.
Baffle A is on the left side and is vertical.
Baffle B is on the top and is horizontal.
Baffle C is on the right side and is vertical.
Baffle D is on the top and is horizontal.
Liquid will flow down if it is above Baffle A and up if it is below.
Liquid will flow to the right if it is to the left of Baffle B and to the left if it is to the right.
Liquid will flow up if it is below Baffle C and down if it is above.
Liquid will flow to the left if it is to the right of Baffle D and to the right if it is to the left.
Liquid from A will flow down if on the left side and up if on the right side.
Liquid from B will flow to the right if to the left and to the left if to the right.
Liquid from C will flow up if below and down if above.
Liquid from D will flow to the right if to the left and to the left if to the right.
Liquid from A flows down into container E if it flows down.
Liquid from B flows into container F if it flows to the right.
Liquid from C flows into container G if it flows up.
Liquid from D flows into container E if it flows to the left.
Liquid from A will flow into container E.
Liquid from B will flow into container F.
Liquid from C will flow into container G.
Liquid from D will flow into container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A flows into container E, B into F, C into G, D into E.
